Identification.LongTitle: Release of Information for Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice, pursuant to section 22 of the Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Assistance Act*, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Regulations respecting the release of information that may assist in locating defaulting spouses and other persons, effective on the day Part I of the said Act comes into force.

Section.Text: In these Regulations, Act means the Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Assistance Act. (Loi)
For the purposes of section 15 of the Act, the following information banks are designated as information banks that may be searched under Part I of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information banks controlled by the Department of Employment and Social Development, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Canada Pension Plan Record of Earnings (ESDC/PPU-140),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Canada Pension Plan — Retirement, Disability, Survivors and Death Benefits (individuals) (ESDC/PPU-146),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: International Social Security — Domestic and Foreign Benefits — Computer Master Benefit Data (ESDC/PPU-175), and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information banks controlled by the Canada Employment Insurance Commission, namely,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: information banks controlled by the Canada Revenue Agency, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Individual Returns and Payment Processing (CRA/PPU-005), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Business Number and Program Account Registration (CRA/PPU-223).

Subsection.Text: An application under section 13 of the Act for the release of information shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the form set out in Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: accompanied by an affidavit in the form set out in Schedule 2 and the supporting documentation required under section 14 of the Act; and

Provision.Text: Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Assistance Unit,

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 14(3) of the Act, where an application under section 13 of the Act is made by a provincial enforcement service, the application and accompanying affidavit may also be sent by the means of electronic communication that has been agreed upon by the provincial enforcement service and the Department of Justice.

Section.Text: The Minister shall, on receiving an application referred to in section 4 together with the supporting documents required under section 14 of the Act, request that the Chairman of the Canada Employment Insurance Commission provide or verify the social insurance number of the person who is the subject of that application, and shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where he receives the social insurance number or verification thereof, transmit a search request in respect of that person to the information bank directors; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where he is informed by the Chairman of the Canada Employment Insurance Commission that the social insurance number cannot be provided or verified, inform the applicant that the search cannot be carried out.

Section.Text: For the purpose of section 17 of the Act and subject to section 7 of these Regulations, an information bank director shall, on receiving a search request from the Minister, search the designated information banks under the control of the information bank director for such information concerning the person who is the subject of the search request as may be released under section 16 of the Act.

Heading.TitleText: Release of Information Between Information Bank Directors

Subsection.Text: An information bank director who receives a search request from the Minister may, before or while carrying out the search referred to in section 6, make a request to the other information bank director for such additional information as may be necessary in order to conduct that search.
An information bank director who receives a request referred to in subsection (1) for additional information shall search the designated information banks under his control and shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the additional information requested is found, communicate the information to the requesting director; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the additional information requested is not found, report that result to the requesting director.

Heading.TitleText: Release of Information to the Minister

Section.Text: An information bank director shall transmit to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in section 6; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the information referred to in section 6 has not been found, a report of that result.
